news_header: The podcast 'Does It Fly?' explores the scientific plausibility of popular sci-fi technologies, hosted by astrophysicist Hakeem Oluseyi and pop culture expert Tamara Krinsky.
news_text: Every print subscription to Science News includes full digital access. The podcast 'Does It Fly?' examines the scientific validity of technologies from beloved sci-fi shows like 'Star Trek' and 'Doctor Who.' Hosted by astrophysicist Hakeem Oluseyi and actress Tamara Krinsky, the show features discussions on how these technologies could work in reality and their impact on storytelling. Each episode, released weekly, delves into various sci-fi concepts, balancing technical feasibility with narrative significance. While some episodes are more successful than others, the hosts' engaging banter and insights make for an entertaining exploration of science fiction.
